Text:
Children across the country are exposed to water from lead pipes which creates real health problems as they grow.

The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law will replace lead pipes, removing lead paint from schools and across our communities so our kids can live in a healthy environment.
We will continue to fight to protect the right to vote with every tool at our disposal. https://t.co/K2PUqIWtNp

Roe v. Wade gave women the ability to control their own bodies, to plan their own families, and to determine their own futures. On this 49th anniversary, let us recommit to doing everything we can to protect those constitutional rights.
https://t.co/Zm2k5SRcXn
From vaccines, boosters, masks, and tests, we have been doing everything we can to save lives and keep businesses and schools open.

From adding 6 million new jobs to the unemployment rate dropping to 3.9%, last year was a year of enormous progress.

We’re getting America’s economy back on track.

In our first year in office:

—More than 6 million jobs created 
—The unemployment rate is down to 3.9%
—Unemployment claims are at their lowest level since 1969

We’re making historic progress for workers, small businesses, and our economy—and it’s only just the beginning.

Both Republican and Democratic administrations have tried for years to pass a comprehensive infrastructure package that upgrades our roads and bridges, replaces our lead pipes, and repairs America’s crumbling infrastructure. 

President Joe Biden got it done. https://t.co/4dXTW1Fkfu

This past year, America has seen record job creation, economic growth, and small business creation. 

We’re rebuilding our economy to lift up all Americans.

Since President Biden and I took office, we have gotten shots in arms, got people back to work, and passed laws that will rebuild our crumbling infrastructure while creating good-paying jobs.

We are delivering on our promises for America’s working families.

Together, we are moving our country towards a brighter future. 
https://t.co/rZm7aIzdez

On January 20, 2021, we set off to heal, rebuild, and strengthen the democracy that we all cherish. 

The work continues.
https://t.co/NEAuiKd3qQ

One year ago, this moment, in many ways, embodied our character as a nation. It demonstrated who we are.

We are undaunted in our belief that we shall overcome; that we will rise up. This is American aspiration. https://t.co/n5Zaabt94q

It’s been one year since the inauguration. This Thursday, join President @JoeBiden and me for a virtual event as we reflect on the first year and what’s ahead. Sign up now. 
https://t.co/ECchswM4sh

Wearing a mask is an important tool to control the spread of COVID-19. 

We can all do our part to help get a hold of the Omicron variant—please stay vigilant and wear a tight-fitting mask.
Our vote is our power. We must continue Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.’s legacy to fight for its freedom. https://t.co/LS0VGFSCzg

We promised better infrastructure to the American people and delivered with our Bipartisan Infrastructure Law. Communities will begin to see improvements in roads and bridges, public transit, and clean drinking water.

I often turn to the words of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. for inspiration. 

Today, I’m keeping these words in mind: the arc of the moral universe is long, but it bends toward justice. https://t.co/HcXneeQSL2

A son of Georgia, Dr. King spent his life fighting for economic and racial justice. His fight for equality and dignity lives on in those today who organize for freedom and justice for all.

To truly celebrate his birth on this day in 1929, we must carry out his work.

Every American child, no matter where they live or their economic status should have access to high-speed internet. 

Our Bipartisan Infrastructure Law has invested $65 billion to get every corner of our country connected—helping students, small businesses, and families.
We are not where we were a year ago—we are building back up. https://t.co/nAS3b4YKiC

Today, President Biden announced that we are in the process of purchasing an additional 500 million more tests to meet future demand. 

The American people will now have more access to convenient COVID-19 at-home tests.

Upholding one of the most important tenets of our democracy—access to the ballot for all eligible voters—should not be a partisan issue.

It’s an American issue.
50 Republicans should not be absolved from the responsibility of preserving and protecting our democracy. https://t.co/buvYxSpjK8

Like so many others, I stand on the shoulders of giants like Congressman John Lewis and remind myself of the work we have left to do. Democracy is stronger when everyone participates—and is weaker when people are left out.

Years from now, our children and grandchildren will ask us what we did at this moment in history.

The U.S. Senate must act with the urgency this moment demands and safeguard our democracy for generations to come. https://t.co/8abqBXw03c

The John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act and the Freedom to Vote Act represent the first real opportunity to secure the freedom to vote since the Supreme Court gutted the Voting Rights Act.

We don't know when we'll have this opportunity again—the Senate must act now.

Make no mistake: There is nothing normal about laws that prevent the American people from exercising their constitutional right to vote. 

Two landmark voting rights bills sit before the Senate. The Senate must act to protect the will of the people. https://t.co/ijeYvXGiZF

We will fight to safeguard our democracy and secure our most fundamental freedom: the freedom to vote. 

The Senate must pass the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act and the Freedom to Vote Act to protect our right to vote.

The Freedom to Vote Act and the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act are about ensuring that all Americans—wherever they live, whatever party they are registered to vote with—have the  ability to exercise their vote.

The Senate must act to protect this sacred right.

We must protect voting rights. 

That’s why the Senate must pass the Freedom to Vote Act and the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act to ensure that everyone can count on  access to the ballot box. https://t.co/1re8h3gpGa

Our democracy is being threatened by an attack on voting rights. 

We must fight to save our democracy by fighting for the right for all people, whoever they vote for, to vote.

For the sake of one of the most important pillars of our democracy, we must put politics aside, step up, and act. 

The Senate must pass the Freedom to Vote Act and the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act.

Activists and leaders including Dr. Martin Luther King, John Lewis, and Rosa Parks have fought to expand voting rights. 

We owe it to future generations to continue to fight for every American’s right to vote and have their vote counted.

The unemployment rate fell to 3.9%—the sharpest one-year drop in unemployment on record. 

We’re making progress for workers, small businesses, and our economy.

States across our nation have passed laws that would make it harder to vote.

We are in a critical moment, and that is why we must pass the Freedom to Vote Act and the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act. It will not be easy, but we must fight back.
What was at stake on January 6, and now, is the right to have our future decided the way the Constitution prescribes it: By We, the People. All the people. https://t.co/a6c4LHn1Qh

Today’s jobs report: 

—Added 6.4 million jobs since January of last year 
—Lowest unemployment rate since the beginning of the pandemic
—Regained 84% of jobs lost in the pandemic 

Today is a historic day of our economic recovery as Americans are getting back to work.
We must defend and strengthen the right that unlocks all other rights: the right to vote.
We must pass the voting rights bills that are before the U.S. Senate to ensure free and fair elections. https://t.co/CiHAUPxX8t

How will January 6 be remembered in the years ahead?

The American spirit is being tested and the answer to whether we will meet that test resides where it always has resided in our country, with you, the people. https://t.co/XtIhwDFoEe

January 6 reflects the dual nature of democracy—its fragility and strength. 

The fragility of democracy is that if we are not vigilant, democracy will not stand.

The strength of democracy is that everyone should be treated equally and that elections should be free and fair.

On January 6, we all saw what our nation would look like if the forces who seek to dismantle our democracy are successful—we cannot let our future be decided by those bent on silencing our voices. https://t.co/xWxQQHh62J

President @JoeBiden has made it clear: Take advantage of what’s available. 

Protect your family and your loved ones. Get vaccinated. https://t.co/ESoPVN8tmy
Children ages 12 to 15 are now eligible to receive a COVID-19 booster shot. This is an enormous step forward in our fight to defeat this virus and protect our kids.

We all know what it means to miss a bus by just one minute—being at least an hour late to work, school, or visiting family during the holidays. 

The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law will invest in our public transit systems to ensure folks can get where they’re going. https://t.co/wXMTckHlAd

The COVID-19 vaccine and booster shots are our best defense in ending this pandemic. 

We need everyone to do their part. Please get vaccinated and get your booster shot.
The best protection against the Omicron variant for yourself, your neighbors, and your family is getting vaccinated and getting a booster shot. Get yours now.

In 2021, we reduced the unemployment rate to 4.2%, reduced the deficit by over $300 billion, and created 6 million jobs.

We’re keeping that progress going as we move into 2022.

We have the power today to have an impact on tomorrow, and we can’t shortchange the significance of that. 

Get vaccinated.
Vaccines are safe, they are free, and they save lives. Get your booster shot today. https://t.co/04ZMHyWTSe

A new year to continue building a better America. 

Let’s get to work. https://t.co/Zqb2yJ0J0y
In states across our nation, public transportation is not as fast or as frequent, as safe or as healthy as it can be—our Bipartisan Infrastructure Law will change that.
May every single day of 2022 be filled with love and joy as we continue our work to build a better America. Wishing you and your loved ones a happy and healthy new year! https://t.co/rHZTi6aQBO
The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law will modernize our airports, roads, and bridges, helping  people get to where they need to go during future holiday seasons.

Our Kwanzaa celebrations are some of my favorite childhood memories. 

As families across the United States light the red, black, and green candles of the Kinara this week, our family sends our wishes and blessings for a happy and healthy new year.
From our family to yours, wishing you a safe and very merry Christmas filled with hope, happiness, and the comfort of loved ones. https://t.co/5fGnEECe66
To our health care and frontline workers who are working tirelessly this Christmas Eve to save lives, we thank you. Your work does not go unnoticed.
My sister Maya and I have always loved Christmas—and there’s no greater gift than spending the holidays with loved ones. Have a safe and joyous holiday season. https://t.co/WAl4V0b9IA
We are working to ensure that Americans have access to free testing, including convenient COVID-19 at-home tests.

Our vaccines are the most powerful tools we have: they work to protect people from serious illness and death, and boosters provide us the strongest protection. 

As we head into the holiday season, let’s all do our part. Get vaccinated.

America’s children are breathing polluted air on their way to school.

By investing in electric school buses with our Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, we will be helping our children’s health. https://t.co/78wuk4trdc

Let it be clear: healthy economies require helping mothers and healthy children.

By investing in maternal health and child care, we will help get working mothers back to work and set our economy up for sustainable, long-term growth.
We must lower the cost of living for working people in America. And to do that, Congress must pass the Build Back Better Act.

1️⃣ Increased Support for Hospitals 
2️⃣ Robust Access to Free Testing 
3️⃣ Expanding Capacity to Get Shots in Arms 

Together, we're working to protect people from the Omicron variant and building a path out of this pandemic.

More than 200 million Americans have been fully vaccinated. 

Let’s not stop here: get vaccinated, and get your booster shot if you haven’t already.

Vaccines are free, convenient and save lives. 

Get vaccinated—not just for yourself, but for your family members and your community.

The maternal mortality crisis has been a big part of my life’s work.

As a U.S Senator, I crafted one of the first bills in history to target racial disparities in maternal mortality and address implicit bias in our health care delivery system—and we continue to do so today.

The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law will soon fix our roads and bridges, replace lead pipes, and connect families in urban and rural areas with accessible high-speed internet—and we will do all of this while creating good-paying jobs.
This is the beginning of the end for lead in America. https://t.co/YoJ8fQgl2O

Our Lead Pipe and Paint Action Plan will coordinate the efforts of local, state, and federal partners toward a single goal:

Accelerating the removal of lead pipes and paint over the next ten years, particularly in communities that have historically been left out and left behind.

Republicans in Congress claim to want to lower costs and address inflation.

But not one supports the Build Back Better Act, which will lower costs on everything from health care to child care—which 17 Nobel Prize-winning economists say will ease long-term inflationary pressures.
In the United States, we are believers. We have faith in one another, in our nation, and our future. We believe a better future is possible—and are determined to build that future.
There is absolutely no good reason why people in 21st century America should still be exposed to lead in their drinking water. https://t.co/LpEWtrxAD6

People who use public transportation spend more of their time in transit rather than spending time with their family, helping their children do their homework, running errands, or even relaxing after a hard day at work.

The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law will change that.

The future of transportation in our nation and around the world is electric.

Our nation’s ability to manufacture, charge, and repair electric vehicles will help determine the health of our communities, the strength of our economy, and the sustainability of our planet.

From establishing San Francisco's first environmental justice unit to working in the Senate to replace toxic drinking water infrastructure, I’ve long worked to clean up pollution.

Now, I’m thrilled to launch our effort to replace every lead pipe in America.

When union wages go up, everybody’s wages go up. 

President Biden and I are determined to be the most pro-labor, pro-union administration in American history.

Our Build Back Better Act will lower costs families have to pay every month—for prescription drugs, home care, child care, and more. And it will level the playing field by making corporations and the wealthiest pay their fair share.

The right to vote cannot be taken for granted—it must be safeguarded and strengthened.

Congress must pass the Freedom to Vote Act and the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act. https://t.co/lGgUDStEU4

Our economy is growing faster than it has in decades. Unemployment is down to 4.2%, and nearly 6 million jobs have been added since January.

We must make sure that everyone shares in this growth by lowering costs for families and removing barriers to success in all communities.
Here’s the bottom line: When we unlock the economic power of communities across America, there is nothing we cannot achieve. https://t.co/4jnHqN1rSX

Democracy is neither an abstract concept nor a static state. 
Democracy lives in the people. 
Democracy is the people.
Democracy is our best hope.

Since Democrats came together to pass the American Rescue Plan, the Biden-Harris Administration has rolled out the most effective vaccination program in history.

Every Republican in Congress voted against it.

The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law will start replacing 100% of our nation’s lead pipes and service lines so every child across America can turn on the faucet in their homes and schools and drink clean water.
Our investment in electric vehicles will be a transformative down payment on our transition to a zero-emission future. https://t.co/PLr88cUT7j

When we ask people, what's the biggest barrier for them to buy an electric car? The answer is almost always figuring out where and how to charge it.

The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law will invest in a network of 500,000 chargers for all Americans for local & long-distance trips.

By developing and deploying chargers for electric vehicles in communities across the country, we’ll ensure that nobody’s left behind as we lead America into the electric future. https://t.co/jof1RemMad

Yesterday, I headed to Prince George’s County, Maryland to discuss the electric vehicle investments in the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law and the Build Back Better Act.

The future of transportation is electric.
We know the path to controlling COVID-19 and limiting variants: get people vaccinated, get them boosted, and get our children over 5 vaccinated. Now is the time.

Seventeen Nobel Prize-winning economists wrote a letter affirming that the Build Back Better Act would reduce longer-term inflationary pressures in the economy.

Congressional Republicans are united against the bill.

Our Build Back Better Act invests in maternal health care by:

-Extending mandatory postpartum Medicaid coverage
-Investing in the maternal, prenatal, and postpartum workforce
-Improving maternal mental health
-Supporting community-based programs

We must act.

Our Build Back Better Act addresses the needs, concerns, and conversations around kitchen tables that are happening across our country—it's time to deliver results for American families. https://t.co/4vkpm9s94Q
Every American deserves access to clean drinking water. The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law will help make that a reality by creating jobs that will start to replace lead pipes across the country.

We must do everything we can to protect and to strengthen both maternal health and reproductive health—our Build Back Better Act will do just that.
https://t.co/0eNA4x1pFQ

No parent should have to sit outside a fast-food restaurant so their child can do their homework online. The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law will create good-paying jobs that will help connect every American to affordable, high-speed internet.

Black women are more than 3x as likely to die from pregnancy-related complications. 

Native American women are more than 2x as likely to die.

Women in rural America are about 60% more likely to die.

Our Build Back Better Act will do something about that.

Democracy protects human rights and promotes human dignity. It’s a means to create peace and prosperity. It’s a means to solve our greatest challenges, from COVID-19 to the climate crisis. 

Democracy is our world’s best hope.

Every day we wait, every day we don’t address maternal mortality, is a day that a mother could die. We’re working on ending this trend. 
https://t.co/PChqiLYI1q

Our National Space Council will focus on three particular areas: 

1️⃣ Building our STEM workforce 
2️⃣ Addressing the climate crisis
3️⃣ Promoting rules and norms that govern space

These will guide our work as we venture through space exploration.
From bringing down the costs of prescription drugs, child care, elder care, we designed the Build Back Better Act to help address the reality of the needs of the American people.
